Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate Donald Trump's position by stating that he wants to "roll back all" of the financial regulations passed after the financial crisis. Trump has expressed a desire to roll back regulations on Wall Street, but it is unclear how much of Dodd-Frank or other regulations he would actually repeal.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Donald Trump's position on financial regulations is solely motivated by a desire to make it easier for banks to cheat people. While Trump has criticized certain aspects of Dodd-Frank and expressed a desire to reduce regulations, it is a problematic assumption to say that his goal is to benefit banks at the expense of consumers.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or specific quotes from Donald Trump to support the assertion that his position is to roll back all of the financial regulations. While he has expressed a desire to reduce regulations, the extent to which he would do so is not clearly stated.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for Donald Trump's position on financial regulations. It is possible that he believes excessive regulations hinder economic growth or that he wants to promote a more business-friendly environment. Without further information, it is difficult to determine the exact motivations behind his stance.
